content.text: HTML Geolocation API
The Geolocation API is used to get the user's current location.
content.html: The Geolocation API is used to get the user's current location.

content.text: Locate the User's Position
The Geolocation API is used to access the user's current location.
content.html: The Geolocation API is used to access the user's current location.

content.text: Since this can compromise privacy, the location is not available unless the user approves it.
content.html: Since this can compromise privacy, the location is not available unless the user approves it.

content.text: Try It
Note: The Geolocation API is only available on secure contexts such as HTTPS.
content.html: Note: The Geolocation API is only available on secure contexts such as HTTPS.

content.text: Tip: The Geolocation API is most accurate for devices with GPS, like smartphones or smartwatches.
content.html: Tip: The Geolocation API is most accurate for devices with GPS, like smartphones or smartwatches.

content.text: Browser Support
The numbers in the table specify the first browser version that fully supports Geolocation.
content.html: The numbers in the table specify the first browser version that fully supports Geolocation.

content.code_html:
API
Geolocation 5.0 12.0 3.5 5.0 10.6

content.text: Using HTML Geolocation API

The Geolocation API is accessed via a call to navigator.geolocation . This will cause the browser to ask the user for permission to access their location data. If the user accept, the browser will search for the best available functionality on the device to access this information (for example GPS).
content.html: The Geolocation API is accessed via a call to navigator.geolocation. This will cause the browser to ask the user for permission to access their location data. If the user accept, the browser will search for the best available functionality on the device to access this information (for example GPS).

content.text: The getCurrentPosition() method is used to return the user's current location.
content.html: The getCurrentPosition() method is used to return the user's current location.

content.text: The example below returns the latitude and longitude of the user's current location:
content.html: The example below returns the latitude and longitude of the user's current location:

syntaxHighlighting.text: "Geolocation is not supported by this browser."

syntax_highlighting.text: "Geolocation is not supported by this browser."

content.code_html:
<script>
const x = document.getElementById("demo");

function getLocation() {
  if (navigator.geolocation) {
    navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition(success, error);
  } else {
    x.innerHTML = "Geolocation is not supported by this browser.";
  }
}

function success(position) {
  x.innerHTML = "Latitude: " + position.coords.latitude +
  "<br>Longitude: " + position.coords.longitude;
}

function error() {
  alert("Sorry, no position available.");
}
</script>

syntax_highlighting_data.text: "Geolocation is not supported by this browser."

content.text: Example explained:
Error Handling and Rejections
The second parameter of the getCurrentPosition() method is used to handle errors. It specifies a function to run if it fails to get the user's location.
content.html: The second parameter of the getCurrentPosition() method is used to handle errors. It specifies a function to run if it fails to get the user's location.

content.text: Here is an example of a more specific error handling:
content.html: Here is an example of a more specific error handling:

syntaxHighlighting.text: "The request to get user location timed out."

syntax_highlighting.text: "The request to get user location timed out."

content.code_html:
function error(error) {
  switch(error.code) {
    case error.PERMISSION_DENIED:
      x.innerHTML = "User denied the request for Geolocation."
      break;
    case error.POSITION_UNAVAILABLE:
      x.innerHTML = "Location information is unavailable."
      break;
    case error.TIMEOUT:
      x.innerHTML = "The request to get user location timed out."
      break;
    case error.UNKNOWN_ERROR:
      x.innerHTML = "An unknown error occurred."
      break;
  }
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: "The request to get user location timed out."

content.text: Location-specific Information
Geolocation is also very useful for location-specific information, like:
content.html: Geolocation is also very useful for location-specific information, like:

content.text: The getCurrentPosition() Method - Return Data
The getCurrentPosition() method returns an object on success. The latitude, longitude and accuracy properties are always returned. The other properties are returned if available:
content.html: The getCurrentPosition() method returns an object on success. The latitude, longitude and accuracy properties are always returned. The other properties are returned if available:

content.code_html:
Property Returns
coords.latitude The latitude as a decimal number (always returned)
coords.longitude The longitude as a decimal number (always returned)
coords.accuracy The accuracy of position (always returned)
coords.altitude The altitude in meters above the mean sea level (returned if available)
coords.altitudeAccuracy The altitude accuracy of position (returned if available)
coords.heading The heading as degrees clockwise from North (returned if available)
coords.speed The speed in meters per second (returned if available)
timestamp The date/time of the response (returned if available)

content.text: Geolocation Object - Other interesting Methods
The Geolocation object also has other interesting methods:
content.html: The Geolocation object also has other interesting methods:

content.text: The example below shows the watchPosition() method. You need an accurate GPS device to test this (like a smartphone):
content.html: The example below shows the watchPosition() method. You need an accurate GPS device to test this (like a smartphone):

syntaxHighlighting.text: "Geolocation is not supported by this browser."
"The request to get user location timed out."

syntax_highlighting.text: "Geolocation is not supported by this browser."
"The request to get user location timed out."

content.code_html:
<script>
const x = document.getElementById("demo");

function getLocation() {
  if (navigator.geolocation) {
    navigator.geolocation.watchPosition(success, error);
  } else {
    x.innerHTML = "Geolocation is not supported by this browser.";
  }
}

function success(position) {
  x.innerHTML = "Latitude: " + position.coords.latitude +
  "<br>Longitude: " + position.coords.longitude;
}

function error(error) {
  switch(error.code) {
    case error.PERMISSION_DENIED:
      x.innerHTML = "User denied the request for Geolocation."
      break;
    case error.POSITION_UNAVAILABLE:
      x.innerHTML = "Location information is unavailable."
      break;
    case error.TIMEOUT:
      x.innerHTML = "The request to get user location timed out."
      break;
    case error.UNKNOWN_ERROR:
      x.innerHTML = "An unknown error occurred."
      break;
  }
}
</script>

syntax_highlighting_data.text: "Geolocation is not supported by this browser."
"The request to get user location timed out."
